DataElement.preferredName: Person Prior Therapy Adverse Event Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable response related to whether a person has fully recovered from adverse events as a result of prior agent administration.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Prior Therapy Adverse Event Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._An indicator that a person has been previously treated for the same condition or with the same therapy._Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used._Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Prior Therapy Adverse Event Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An indicator that a person has been previously treated for the same condition or with the same therapy.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Prior action or administration of therapeutic agents that produced an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to GOG for REBOYJ by script Thu Aug 1 14:45:44 EDT 2013

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient failed to recover
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to baseline or CTCAE less than or equal to grade 1 from toxicity due to all prior therapies except alopecia and other non-clinically significant AEs defined as lab elevation with no associated symptoms or  sequelae?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to agents administered?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to agents administered more than 3 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover (less than or equal to grade 1) from adverse events due to agents administered (except for alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events (to grade less than or equal to in severity) due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from acute adverse events to grade less than 2 or baseline due to agents administered, with exception of alopecia, unless approved by the Protocol Chair?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from clinically significant adverse events due to prior agents administered to less than or equal to grade 1 or baseline with the exception of alopecia and peripheral neurophathy, unless approved by Protocol Chair?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover (less than or equal to grade 1 or baseline) from adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier (except for alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to CTCAE grade 2 or less from serious (CTCAE grade 3 or more) adverse events from the previously received agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events (except alopecia) due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than CTCAE Grade 1 or baseline, with the exception of alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to agents administered more than 2 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from serious adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior administered agents as noted above?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to fully recover from acute, reversible effects of prior chemotherapy regardless of interval since last treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1, except alopecia, peripheral sensory neuropathy, and stable endocrine insufficiencies such as thyroid and adrenal insufficiency)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from toxicities from prior anti-tumor therapy, defined as not having resolved to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0, grade 0 or 1, or to levels dictated in the eligibility criteria with the exception of alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1), except alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to less than grade 1 from adverse events due to agents administered more than 3 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to eligibility levels from prior toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to less than or equal to grade 1 from adverse events due to agents administered more than 3 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events (other than alopecia) due to agents administered more than 3 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., has residual toxicities greater than Grade 1)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from serious (CTCAE grade 3 or more)  adverse events to grade 2 or less from prior therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1, except for alopecia, neuropathy, lymphocytopenia and other non-clinically significant adverse events)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events (except alopecia) due to agents administered more than 2 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1), with the exception of patients with less than or equal to grade 2 neuropathy or less than or equal to grade 2 alopecia who may qualify for the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to grade 1 or less (except alopecia) from adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from clinically significant adverse events (other than alopecia) due to prior anti-cancer therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -  33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to grade less than or equal to 1 from adverse events (other than alopecia) due to agents administered more than 3 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to grade less than or equal to 1 adverse events (other than alopecia) due to agents administered more than 3 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy to grade 1 or baseline?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., has residual toxicities greater than Grade 1), except for Grade 2 anorexia, alopecia, neuropathy, and fatigue, for which resolution is not required?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from toxicities from prior anti-tumor therapy, defined as not having resolved to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 5.0, grade 0 or 1, or to levels dictated in the eligibility criteria with the exception of alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from serious (CTCAE grade 3 or higher) adverse events to grade 1 or less from prior therapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than grade 1 except peripheral neuropathy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events (other than alopecia) due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier (i.e., has residual toxicities greater than Grade 1)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to baseline or CTCAE less than or equal to Grade 1 from adverse events due to all prior anti-cancer therapies except alopecia, oxaliplatin-related neuropathy, and other non-clinically significant adverse events?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from all non-hematologic adverse events of prior chemotherapy, surgery, or radiotherapy, except alopecia, to National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) grade less than or equal to 2 prior to starting therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1, except alopecia) that was administered more than four weeks prior to starting study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 45
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1) with the exception of alopecia, or peripheral neuropathy (up to Grade 2 is permitted)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 44
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover (resolved or stabilized) from adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to previously administered agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 46
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from major side effects, or open biopsy within 7 days before start of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 47
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive prior therapy with a checkpoint inhibitor and was taken off drug for serious adverse events?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 48
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., has residual toxicities greater than Grade 1), except for grade 2 peripheral sensory neuropathy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 51
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy except hair loss and peripheral neuropathy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 50
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to less than or equal to grade 1 from persistent toxicities caused by previous anticancer therapy,  excluding alopecia, or should be stable chronic grade 2 toxicities that do not overlap with presumed toxicities of olaparib and/or AZD6738?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 49
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from greater than or equal to  grade 2 adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy with the exception of alopecia, vitiligo, and the laboratory values defined in the inclusion criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 52
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have adverse events (excluding alopecia) due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier recovered to less than Grade 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 53
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1), except alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 54
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1, except for alopecia or neuropathy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 55
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., has residual toxicities greater than Grade 1 per CTCAE v.5)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 59
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient not recovered from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e. have residual toxicities greater than grade 1) with the exception of alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 60
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1, except for alopecia and neuropathy less than or equal to grade 2)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 58
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy   (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1) with the exception of alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 57
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient not recovered to grade 1 or better from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (not including Cycle 1 of EPOCH, CHOP, or CHOPE if received off protocol) within 14 days prior to enrollment, with the exception of alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 56
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from AEs due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have not returned to baseline or have residual toxicities greater than grade 1) with the exception of less than or equal to grade 2 neuropathy and alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 61
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have all non-hematological adverse events of any prior chemotherapy, surgery, or radiotherapy, except alopecia, resolved to NCI-CTCAE Grade less than or equal to 2 prior to starting therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from greater than or equal to grade 2 adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy with the exception of alopecia, vitiligo, and the laboratory values defined in the inclusion criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 62
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than grade 1) with the exceptions of alopecia and endocrinopathies from prior immunotherapy-based treatments that are well controlled with hormone replacement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 63
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior mFOLFOX6 chemotherapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1) with the exception of alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 64
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to eligibility levels from prior toxicity or adverse events?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 65
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1) with the exception of alopecia, thyroid dysfunction or neuropathy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 66
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events (except alopecia or neuropathy) due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 67
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from clinically significant adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1) with the exception of neuropathy, which should resolve to grade 2, or alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 68
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from acute clinically significant adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1) with the exception of alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 69
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from clinically significant adverse events of their most recent therapy/intervention prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 70
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from clinically-significant adverse events of their most recent cancer immunotherapy to grade 1 or less, (with the exception of alopecia and lymphopenia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 71
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1) with the exception of alopecia?
